tool.name: Compound search
tool.description: - an advanced molecular search program using SMARTS

param.name: inp
param.label: Input
param.option: Upload one or more SMARTS patterns in a text file

param.name: smarts_pattern
param.label: SMARTS Pattern
param.help: Specify a SMARTS Pattern for your search.

param.name: query
param.label: Query file
param.help: One SMARTS pattern in each line.

param.name: invert_matches
param.label: Perform an inverted search, i.e. print non-matching molecules

param.name: n_times
param.label: Print a molecule only if the pattern occurs this often inside the molecule

param.name: only_name
param.label: Only print the name of the molecules

param.name: full_match
param.label: Full match
param.help: Print matching molecules only when the number of heavy atoms equals the number of atoms in the SMARTS pattern

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What this tool does**
Uses the Open Babel Obgrep_ to search for molecules inside multi-molecule files (e.g. SMI, SDF, etc.) or across multiple files. Not all SMARTS features from the original implementation in the Daylight Toolkit are supported by OpenBabel; please have a look here_.
The search query can be submitted either as a single SMARTS pattern or as a file containing multiple SMARTS patterns.
.. _Obgrep: http://openbabel.org/wiki/Obgrep .. _here: http://openbabel.org/wiki/SMARTS
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
| - `SD-Format`_ | - `SMILES Format`_
.. _SD-Format: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chemical_table_file .. _SMILES Format: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simplified_molecular_input_line_entry_specification
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
Same as input format.
